utterances.translation: Son of Crane thought to himself that it was time for him to get a wife.
He went to Daughter of Sawbill to propose.

utterances.transcript: wim̓aaqƛ yawaačiʔatquu ʕaanism̓it ʔan qʷac̓aɬaq ƛuɬy̓iiḥa ḥaakʷaaƛ saapinqas.
utterances.translation: No one could disagree with Son of Crane because of Daughter of Sawbill was a very pretty girl.
“I came to propose to you; I want to marry you,” said Son of Crane.
“I don’t want to marry you; you are nothing; you are too ugly,” [said Daughter of Sawbill].
“Ha! Ugly? Nothing?” said Son of Crane.
Son of Crane got really angry about the fact that she refused him and that she considered him too ugly.
“She will wish she had never said that,” Son of Crane said.

utterances.transcript: ʔun̓aaḥšiƛ yaʕat̓aaḥii ʕasayat, n̓ašiƛ̓asʔaƛ ʔuukʷiɬ č̓ikn̓am̓it.
utterances.translation: He went to find someone who could give him advice. He went to see Son of Wren.

utterances.transcript: čuu, qʷiscumyiis, wikḥsaaʔats saapinqas, wiitqp̓aaʔatsiš, wikstupʔick wawaaʔatsiš.
utterances.translation: “Now, what should I do? Daughter of Sawbill refused my proposal. She said to me that I am too ugly and that I am nothing” [Son of Crane told Son Wren].
Son of Wren saw that he really wanted to get even.
He started to think (Son of Crane).
“It’s easy,” he told him.

utterances.transcript: ʔucačiʔum nučiiʔi, ƛ̓amaassiƛsuuk ʔiiḥquu ʕaɬmapt, hitaqinuʔum, ƛ̓uuɬapiqḥʔaƛsuuk, n̓ačḥtaakḥ ʔaḥ waa.
utterances.translation: “Go to the mountain; you climb on top of a big yellow cedar tree; stretch your arms out and look to the sea; and say this,”

utterances.transcript: naana wanin siin ki ʔii, ƛuu puč ma kin siin ki ʔii.
utterances.translation: “She said to me; she said to me; Let the sea rise; let the tide come in.”

utterances.transcript: qʷisckʷaaƛquuk ʔaḥ, n̓aacsaʔaqƛ̓ick ʔič̓ačiƛ tup̓aɬ. muuɬšiƛ̓aqt̓iš.
utterances.translation: “When you have done this, you will see the sea rise. There will be a flood.”

utterances.transcript: qʷis ʕaanism̓it waaʔatʔitq, hinumsinƛ nučii, ʔuuwaƛ ʔiiḥs ʕaɬmapt, ʔiiḥs ʕaɬmapt, ƛ̓amaasiƛ, ƛ̓uuɬapuƛ, n̓ačḥtaakḥʔaƛ waa waamaḥsap̓anitʔitq,
utterances.translation: Son of Crane did as he was told. He went up the mountain, and found a big yellow cedar tree; he climbed the tree, raised his hands, looking out to sea, he said what he was told to say:

utterances.transcript: naana wanin siin ki ʔii, ƛuu puč ma kin siin ki ʔii.
utterances.translation: “She said to me she said to me Let the sea rise let the tide come in.”

utterances.transcript: muup̓itʕaƛ̓ap̓at. n̓aacsaaƛ ʔuyaasiɬa hiɬačišitʔi ʔič̓ačiƛ tup̓aɬ.
utterances.translation: He chanted this for four times, and something started to happen to the ocean: the water rose.

utterances.transcript: čaani ƛuuɬḥap, way! ɬuḥšiʔaƛ, ɬuḥšiʔaƛ. ʔay̓ix ɬuḥaa.
utterances.translation: At first slowly, then it flooded and flooded. It flooded fast.
You could not see anything.

utterances.transcript: ḥaʔii nučiiʔi, ʔana wiḥʔaaʔa hiy̓aaʔaʔitq ʕaanism̓it.
utterances.translation: All the way to the mountain, the only place dry was where Son of Crane was.
He was on top of the mountain.
It was flooded for a long time.

utterances.transcript: niyasu hihiqtup, qaḥkʷačiƛ hihiqtup, y̓uuqʷaa qaḥkʷačiƛ hiɬačištʔatḥʔi maamaati, hakʷiiḥaʔaɬ.
utterances.translation: Everything was under the water; everything died, even the birds that lived on the sea died; they starved.
The water slowly went down.
Son of Crane realized that he had done great damage.

utterances.transcript: n̓aacsiičiƛ ʔan hišsuuƛ maamaatistup, k̓ʷiišk̓ʷiik̓ʷa, č̓ikn̓a, c̓ixʷatin, hišuk qaḥkʷačiƛm̓inḥ.
utterances.translation: He saw that all the birds had died: robin, wren, and eagle — all of them died.
Son of Crane throught to himself that he would bring them back to life.
He brought all of them back to life.
None of them realized that they had been dead.
Daughter of Sawbill drifted far away, all by herself.
All of this happened because she refused to marry Son of Crane.

utterances.transcript: ʔunw̓iiƛḥʔaaɬ ʔaḥʔaa c̓aawaačinkʔaaɬ saapinqas kʷiƛkʷiscač kʷisqʔičḥšiʔaƛquu, c̓aawuu wačaak naaty̓aqakuk.
utterances.translation: That is why Daughter of Sawbill is always alone, going to different places year after year, taking care of her babies by herself.

utterances.transcript: wiiy̓aat n̓aacsaat saapinm̓it. qʷaaʔaƛ ƛaḥ ʔuyi wiiy̓a ʔuušink.
utterances.translation: You never see Mr. Sawbill. It’s that way: she’s never with anyone.

utterances.transcript: ḥaaḥuupay̓ak — ʔunw̓iiƛ ʔaḥʔaa wiiy̓aat y̓umwaaʔat quuʔas, wiiy̓aat ʔuuktisʔat qʷaaʔiitq ƛuɬquu, witqquu quuʔas.
utterances.translation: Lesson — This is the reason that you never refuse a person, you never go by his/her appearances (if s/he is pretty or ugly looking).
